blocks.subtitle: Ping Pong Alkmaar
blocks.title: Recreational & performance
blocks.description:
Ping Pong Alkmaar is the most enthusiastic table tennis club in Alkmaar and an ambitious sports association where everyone is welcome.

Since its founding in May 2018, we have grown tremendously. The club has launched several new initiatives, and with our programs that reach out into the neighborhood, we have reached more than 6,000 people in Alkmaar.

The core of our club consists of 50 regular players, including 30 boys and girls between the ages of 5 and 16. As a member of our club, you can attend training sessions five days a week.

blocks.subtitle: Ping Pong Alkmaar
blocks.title: Competition players
blocks.description: At Ping Pong Alkmaar you can play competition at different levels. On average, about 20 times a year matches will be played. Both home and away matches. A match will take approximately 3 hours, and home matches take place on a Saturday. The start time of the away matches vary per club.

blocks.subtitle: Ping Pong Alkmaar
blocks.title: Training Times
blocks.description:
Monday
Youth training: 18:00 - 20:00
Free play: 20:00 - 23:30

Tuesday
Free play: 19:30 - 23:30

Wednesday
Oldstars: 12:30 - 13:30
Youth training: 18:30 - 19:30

Free play: 21:00 - 23:30

Friday
Minis: 15:00 - 16:00
Youth training: 16:00 - 17:00
Free play: 19:30 - 21:30

Saturday
Youth competition: 12:00 - 17:00

blocks.subtitle: Ping Pong Alkmaar
blocks.title: Hall Rules
blocks.description:
Hall 18 will sometimes not be available outside competition days, pay attention to announcements!

New
When the competition on Friday is finished, hall 20 can be used from 19:30 to 24:00 for free play, also during holidays. When the competition on Saturday is finished, we can use hall 20 from 12:00 to 17:00 for free play or to organize something, also during holidays. If you want to use the hall on Saturday, you must report this to Rob, Ingrid or Johan. For youth players, an adult must always be present.

Hall usage rules
Open the door with your QR code and place the pin between the door and hold your QR code to the QR reader again. The door will automatically lock when you leave. With the key in the key box you can open the canteen (code 1971). After finishing, clean everything up neatly and pull down the canteen roller blind and also turn off the lighting in the canteen. Put the canteen key back in the key box. The light in the hall automatically turns off after the booked playing time. Remove the pin and close the outside door, check that the doors of both halls are locked.

blocks.subtitle: Ping Pong Alkmaar
blocks.title: Memberschip fees
blocks.description:
Youth Non-Competition players (1 session p/week): € 140,00 per year
Youth Non-Competition players (> 1 session p/week): € 170,00 per year
Youth Competition players (> 1 session p/week): € 289,00 per year

Senior Non-Competition players (> 1 session p/week): € 160,00 per year
Senior Competition players (> 1 session p/week): € 215,00 per year

blocks.subtitle: Ping Pong Alkmaar
blocks.title: Activities and commitment
blocks.description:
Our commitment to developing table tennis in Alkmaar’s schools is very important to the future growth, sustainability and longer term success of Ping Pong Alkmaar.

The benefits for school children playing regular table tennis are very clear and positive. Playing table tennis improves hand-eye coordination, balance and motoric movement. Table tennis increases levels of concentration, therefore physical and mentality it is a fantastic activity for the development of young people. Table tennis in a school setting also provides a welcome stress release for pupils in a relaxing social setting. Table tennis has a fun, social and relaxing function.

image.alt: Ping Pong Alkmaar activity event to Germany

blocks.subtitle: Ping Pong Alkmaar
blocks.title: Community
blocks.description: This session is for competition players aiming to reach their full potential. Session intensity is high focusing on technical, tactical and physical development of the players. Players learn to develop a ‘top sport’ mentality to give them the knowledge of high level training methods to reach the higher levels of the game.

blocks.subtitle: Ping Pong Alkmaar
blocks.title: Youth
blocks.description: Our junior sessions are inclusive sessions for youngsters of all levels. Sessions are structured to include ‘technical skills’ together with fun games to maximise the enjoyment and therefore improvement levels of our youngsters. Chinese training methods are used during the sessions including ‘multi-ball’ and ‘robot training’ to focus all players on physical and technical areas of the game.
